intro: Pontia grandis, commonly known as the large white butterflyweed, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. Its flowers are white with prominent yellow veins, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Pontia grandis is often found in meadows and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
